criteria: Analysis of Nuances in Word Meanings
descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of figurative language. Unable to identify or interpret any figures of speech.
Struggles to identify figurative language. Interpretation is often inaccurate or missing.
Identifies some examples of figurative language but struggles with accurate interpretation in context.
Generally understands figurative language and can identify common figures of speech with some accuracy. Interpretation may lack depth.
Demonstrates a good understanding of figurative language, accurately interpreting figures of speech and explaining their basic role in the text.
Demonstrates a strong understanding of figurative language, skillfully interpreting figures of speech (e.g., hyperbole, paradox) in context and thoroughly analyzing their role in the text.
Shows no awareness of nuances in word meanings. Uses words without regard to connotation or subtle differences.
Struggles to differentiate between words with similar denotations. Understanding of nuances is minimal.
Recognizes that words can have slightly different meanings but struggles to explain the nuances effectively.
Generally understands that words with similar denotations can have different nuances and attempts to explain these differences.
Analyzes nuances in the meaning of words with similar denotations with reasonable accuracy, providing some supporting evidence.
Skillfully analyzes nuances in the meaning of words with similar denotations, providing insightful explanations and demonstrating a strong command of vocabulary.
